intro: Prostanthera scutata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mintbush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grey-green leaves and spikes of small, pale blue to violet flowers. It is typically found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky outcrops and sandy soils. Prostanthera scutata is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
